poem:
### On the Passing of a Baker

In the silence of flour,  
the golden touch, he knew—  
an artisan's pride  
wrapped simply.  
Airports whisper his name,  
carrying the taste of home,  
untouched by time.  
He built bridges  
not of steel, but sweet dough,  
feeding a hunger  
for simplicity—  
a lesson in a loaf,  
a legacy crumbling softly.
